zh-CN.content: 注意事项
注意事项在使用 Viteland 构建静态站点时，请注意以下事项，以确保项目顺利进行。
目录结构
目录结构确保项目目录结构清晰，建议如下：

my-viteland-site/
├── docs/
│   ├── config.js
│   ├── guide/
│   │   ├── start/
│   │   │   └── index.zh-CN.md
│   │   ├── install/
│   │   │   └── index.zh-CN.md
│   │   ├── config/
│   │   │   └── index.zh-CN.md
│   │   └── attention/
│   │       └── index.zh-CN.md
│   └── index.mdx
└── package.json
文件命名
文件命名使用小写字母和连字符（-）命名文件和目录。确保文件扩展名正确，例如 `.md` 或 `.mdx`。
配置文件
配置文件确保 `docs/config.js` 文件存在且配置正确。配置文件中的路径和链接应与实际文件结构一致。
国际化
国际化在配置文件中正确设置 `i18n` 配置项。确保每个语言版本的文档都存在，并且路径正确。
插件使用
插件使用在 `vite.config.ts` 中正确引入和配置插件，例如 `pluginRoutes`。确保插件配置项与项目需求匹配。
构建和部署
构建和部署在构建之前，确保所有文档和配置文件都已保存并且没有错误。构建完成后，将 `build` 目录中的文件上传到部署平台。
常见问题
常见问题
开发服务器无法启动
开发服务器无法启动检查 `vite.config.ts` 文件中的配置是否正确。确保所有依赖项已正确安装。
路由无法生成
路由无法生成检查 `pluginRoutes` 插件的配置是否正确。确保项目目录结构符合插件要求。通过遵循以上注意事项，您可以更顺利地使用 Viteland 构建和部署静态站点。
配置指南
配置指南在 Viteland 项目中，您可以通过配置文件 `config.js` 来定义站点的基本信息、导航、搜索等功能。以下是配置文件的详细说明。
基本配置
基本配置创建或修改 `docs/config.js` 文件，添加以下内容：
配置项说明
配置项说明
title
title`title` 是站点的标题，将显示在浏览器标签页和站点的顶部。
themeConfig
themeConfig`themeConfig` 包含站点主题的配置项。
nav
nav`nav` 是导航栏的配置，包含导航项的文本和链接。
sidebar
sidebar`sidebar` 是侧边栏的配置，包含侧边栏的文本和链接。
github
github`github` 是 GitHub 仓库的链接，将显示在站点的右上角。
i18n
i18n`i18n` 是国际化配置，包含语言代码和对应的文本。
示例
示例以下是一个完整的配置示例：
通过以上配置，您可以轻松自定义 Viteland 站点的外观和功能。
国际化配置指南
国际化配置指南在 Viteland 项目中，您可以通过配置文件 `config.js` 来实现国际化支持。以下是详细的配置说明。
基本配置
基本配置创建或修改 `docs/config.js` 文件，添加以下内容：
配置项说明
配置项说明
i18n
i18n`i18n` 是国际化配置，包含语言代码和对应的文本。每个语言代码对应一个文本，表示该语言的名称。
nav
nav`nav` 是导航栏的配置，包含导航项的文本和链接。通过添加 `text-en-US` 等属性，可以为不同语言设置不同的文本。
sidebar
sidebar`sidebar` 是侧边栏的配置，包含侧边栏的文本和链接。通过添加 `text-en-US` 等属性，可以为不同语言设置不同的文本。
示例
示例以下是一个完整的配置示例：
通过以上配置，您可以轻松实现 Viteland 站点的国际化支持。
快速启动
快速启动欢迎使用 Viteland！以下是快速启动指南，帮助您快速搭建一个基于 Viteland 的静态站点。
安装
安装首先，全局安装 Viteland：
npm install -g viteland
开发
开发启动开发服务器：
vl dev
打开浏览器访问，您将看到默认的 Viteland 站点。
编写内容
编写内容在 `docs` 目录中创建一个新的 Markdown 文件（例如：`index.mdx`），并编写您的内容：

# 欢迎使用 Viteland

这是您的第一个 Viteland 页面！
配置项目
配置项目在项目的 `docs` 目录中创建或修改配置文件（如 `config.js`），定义站点的基本信息、导航、搜索等功能：
构建
构建构建您的静态站点：
vl build
部署
部署将 `build` 目录中的文件上传到您的部署平台，即可完成网站上线。恭喜！您已经成功搭建了一个基于 Viteland 的静态站点。
欢迎使用我们基于 Vite 的强大静态站点生成器！这个工具不仅提供了丰富的开发体验，还支持在 Markdown 文件中编写 React 组件，并拥有强大的默认全文搜索主题。让我们开始快速创建您的静态站点吧。
简介
简介我们的静态站点生成器具备以下核心功能：🚀 基于 Vite：带来快速的开发和构建体验。📝 MDX 支持：使您可以在 Markdown 文件中无缝编写和使用 React 组件。🔥 全功能搜索主题：支持多语言（i18n）等特性，让您的网站内容检索更高效。🏝️ 岛屿架构：通过减少客户端捆绑包大小和实现部分水化，提升性能。
快速开始
快速开始

npm install -g viteland
vl dev
编写内容
编写内容创建 Markdown 文件：在 content 目录中，创建一个新的 Markdown 文件（例如：index.mdx），编写您的内容并添加 React 组件：
您可以在该文件中直接使用 React 组件，如
配置项目：
配置项目：在项目的 docs 目录创建或修改配置文件（如 config.js），定义站点的基本信息、导航、搜索等功能。这是一份基本的配置示例：
部署
部署在选择部署平台后，根据平台要求将 build 目录中的文件上传即可完成网站上线。
配置指南
配置指南在 Viteland 项目中，您可以通过配置文件 `config.js` 来定义站点的基本信息、导航、搜索等功能。以下是配置文件的详细说明。
基本配置
基本配置创建或修改 `docs/config.js` 文件，添加以下内容：
配置项说明
配置项说明
title
title`title` 是站点的标题，将显示在浏览器标签页和站点的顶部。
themeConfig
themeConfig`themeConfig` 包含站点主题的配置项。
nav
nav`nav` 是导航栏的配置，包含导航项的文本和链接。
sidebar
sidebar`sidebar` 是侧边栏的配置，包含侧边栏的文本和链接。
github
github`github` 是 GitHub 仓库的链接，将显示在站点的右上角。
i18n
i18n`i18n` 是国际化配置，包含语言代码和对应的文本。
示例
示例以下是一个完整的配置示例：
通过以上配置，您可以轻松自定义 Viteland 站点的外观和功能。

en-US.content: Internationalization Configuration GuideIn a Viteland project, you can achieve internationalization support through the `config.js` configuration file. Below is a detailed configuration guide.
Basic ConfigurationCreate or modify the `docs/config.js` file and add the following content:
i18n`i18n` is the internationalization configuration, containing language codes and corresponding texts. Each language code corresponds to a text representing the name of that language.

nav`nav` is the configuration of the navigation bar, containing the text and links of the navigation items. By adding attributes such as `text-zh-CN`, you can set different texts for different languages.

sidebar`sidebar` is the configuration of the sidebar, containing the text and links of the sidebar items. By adding attributes such as `text-zh-CN`, you can set different texts for different languages.
ExampleBelow is a complete configuration example:
With the above configuration, you can easily achieve internationalization support for the Viteland site.
PrecautionsWhen using Viteland to build static sites, please pay attention to the following points to ensure the project runs smoothly.
Directory StructureEnsure the project directory structure is clear, suggested as follows:

my-viteland-site/
├── docs/
│   ├── config.js
│   ├── guide/
│   │   ├── start/
│   │   │   └── index.en-US.md
│   │   ├── install/
│   │   │   └── index.en-US.md
│   │   ├── config/
│   │   │   └── index.en-US.md
│   │   └── attention/
│   │       └── index.en-US.md
│   └── index.mdx
└── package.json
File NamingUse lowercase letters and hyphens (-) to name files and directories.Ensure the file extensions are correct, such as `.md` or `.mdx`.
Configuration FileEnsure the `docs/config.js` file exists and is configured correctly.The paths and links in the configuration file should match the actual file structure.
InternationalizationCorrectly set the `i18n` configuration item in the configuration file.Ensure that documents for each language version exist and the paths are correct.
Plugin UsageCorrectly import and configure plugins in `vite.config.ts`, such as `pluginRoutes`.Ensure the plugin configuration items match the project requirements.

Build and DeploymentBefore building, ensure all documents and configuration files are saved and there are no errors.After the build is complete, upload the files in the `build` directory to the deployment platform.
Development Server Cannot StartCheck if the configuration in the `vite.config.ts` file is correct.Ensure all dependencies are installed correctly.

Routes Cannot Be GeneratedCheck if the configuration of the `pluginRoutes` plugin is correct.Ensure the project directory structure meets the plugin requirements.By following the above precautions, you can use Viteland to build and deploy static sites more smoothly.

Configuration GuideIn a Viteland project, you can define the basic information, navigation, search, and other functions of the site through the `config.js` configuration file. Below is a detailed explanation of the configuration file.
Basic ConfigurationCreate or modify the `docs/config.js` file and add the following content:
title`title` is the title of the site, which will be displayed in the browser tab and at the top of the site.
themeConfig`themeConfig` contains the configuration items for the site theme.
nav`nav` is the configuration of the navigation bar, containing the text and links of the navigation items.
sidebar`sidebar` is the configuration of the sidebar, containing the text and links of the sidebar items.
github`github` is the link to the GitHub repository, which will be displayed in the upper right corner of the site.
i18n`i18n` is the internationalization configuration, containing the language codes and corresponding texts.
ExampleBelow is a complete configuration example:
With the above configuration, you can easily customize the appearance and functionality of the Viteland site.

Welcome to our powerful static site generator based on Vite! This tool not only provides a rich development experience but also supports writing React components in Markdown files and has a powerful default full-text search theme. Let's start quickly creating your static site.

IntroductionOur static site generator has the following core features:🚀 Based on Vite: Provides a fast development and build experience.📝 MDX support: Allows you to seamlessly write and use React components in Markdown files.🔥 Full-featured search theme: Supports features such as multilingual (i18n), making your website content retrieval more efficient.🏝️ Island architecture: Improves performance by reducing client bundle size and achieving partial hydration.
Writing ContentCreate a Markdown file:In the content directory, create a new Markdown file (e.g., index.mdx), write your content, and add React components:
You can directly use React components in this file, such as

Configuring the Project:Create or modify the configuration file (e.g., config.js) in the project's docs directory to define the basic information, navigation, search, and other functions of the site.Here is a basic configuration example:
DeploymentAfter selecting the deployment platform, upload the files in the build directory according to the platform requirements to complete the website launch.
Quick StartWelcome to Viteland! Here is a quick start guide to help you quickly set up a static site based on Viteland.
Open your browser and visit `http://localhost:3000`, you will see the default Viteland site.
Writing ContentCreate a new Markdown file (e.g., `index.mdx`) in the `docs` directory and write your content:

# Welcome to Viteland

This is your first Viteland page!

Configuring the ProjectCreate or modify the configuration file (e.g., `config.js`) in the project's `docs` directory to define the basic information, navigation, search, and other functions of the site:
DeploymentUpload the files in the `build` directory to your deployment platform to complete the website launch.Congratulations! You have successfully set up a static site based on Viteland.
Internationalization Configuration GuideIn a Viteland project, you can achieve internationalization support through the `config.js` configuration file. Below is a detailed configuration guide.
Basic ConfigurationCreate or modify the `docs/config.js` file and add the following content:
i18n`i18n` is the internationalization configuration, containing language codes and corresponding texts. Each language code corresponds to a text representing the name of that language.

nav`nav` is the configuration of the navigation bar, containing the text and links of the navigation items. By adding attributes such as `text-zh-CN`, you can set different texts for different languages.

sidebar`sidebar` is the configuration of the sidebar, containing the text and links of the sidebar items. By adding attributes such as `text-zh-CN`, you can set different texts for different languages.
ExampleBelow is a complete configuration example:
With the above configuration, you can easily achieve internationalization support for the Viteland site.
PrecautionsWhen using Viteland to build static sites, please pay attention to the following points to ensure the project runs smoothly.
Directory StructureEnsure the project directory structure is clear, suggested as follows:

my-viteland-site/
├── docs/
│   ├── config.js
│   ├── guide/
│   │   ├── start/
│   │   │   └── index.en-US.md
│   │   ├── install/
│   │   │   └── index.en-US.md
│   │   ├── config/
│   │   │   └── index.en-US.md
│   │   └── attention/
│   │       └── index.en-US.md
│   └── index.mdx
└── package.json
File NamingUse lowercase letters and hyphens (-) to name files and directories.Ensure the file extensions are correct, such as `.md` or `.mdx`.
Configuration FileEnsure the `docs/config.js` file exists and is configured correctly.The paths and links in the configuration file should match the actual file structure.
InternationalizationCorrectly set the `i18n` configuration item in the configuration file.Ensure that documents for each language version exist and the paths are correct.
Plugin UsageCorrectly import and configure plugins in `vite.config.ts`, such as `pluginRoutes`.Ensure the plugin configuration items match the project requirements.

Build and DeploymentBefore building, ensure all documents and configuration files are saved and there are no errors.After the build is complete, upload the files in the `build` directory to the deployment platform.
Development Server Cannot StartCheck if the configuration in the `vite.config.ts` file is correct.Ensure all dependencies are installed correctly.

Routes Cannot Be GeneratedCheck if the configuration of the `pluginRoutes` plugin is correct.Ensure the project directory structure meets the plugin requirements.By following the above precautions, you can use Viteland to build and deploy static sites more smoothly.

Configuration GuideIn a Viteland project, you can define the basic information, navigation, search, and other functions of the site through the `config.js` configuration file. Below is a detailed explanation of the configuration file.
Basic ConfigurationCreate or modify the `docs/config.js` file and add the following content:
title`title` is the title of the site, which will be displayed in the browser tab and at the top of the site.
themeConfig`themeConfig` contains the configuration items for the site theme.
nav`nav` is the configuration of the navigation bar, containing the text and links of the navigation items.
sidebar`sidebar` is the configuration of the sidebar, containing the text and links of the sidebar items.
github`github` is the link to the GitHub repository, which will be displayed in the upper right corner of the site.
i18n`i18n` is the internationalization configuration, containing the language codes and corresponding texts.
ExampleBelow is a complete configuration example:
With the above configuration, you can easily customize the appearance and functionality of the Viteland site.
